questions.question: There ………………………….. a famine in Bengal in
questions.description: We use the simple past to talk about finished actions and situations.

questions.question: Gandhi …………………………… in the principle of non-violence.
They have not …………………………. yet.
questions.description: We use a past participle form after has, have and had.

questions.question: She ………………………… not want to quit her job.
questions.description: We make questions and negatives in the simple present tense with do and does. We use does with singular nouns and pronouns.

questions.question: The ozone layer ……………………………… us from harmful ultraviolet radiations.
questions.description: We use the simple present to talk about facts.

questions.question: She ……………………………… her studies before she went abroad.
questions.description: We use the past perfect for the earlier of two past actions.

questions.question: I …………………………….. him on several occasions before he went to America.
questions.description: We use the past perfect for the earlier of two past actions or situations.

questions.question: Jenny …………………………….. alone in her apartment.
questions.description: We use the simple present to talk about facts.

questions.question: When I was young, I …………………………… every day.
questions.description: We use the simple past to talk about past habits.

questions.question: We ……………………………. for Malaysia tonight.
questions.description: We use the present continuous to talk about pre-planned future events.

questions.question: Did you ………………………………. him yesterday?
questions.description: We use the first form of the verb after do, does and did.
